intro: Phymosia abutiloides, commonly known as the silky abutilion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms and unique foliage.
